title: Australians Come Home After Years  in ISIS Detention Camp
description: Dozens more Australians, many of them children, are still being held in Syria, but there is hope that the government will soon sponsor more releases.
dc:creator: Natasha Frost and Livia Albeck-Ripka
category: Islamic State in Iraq and Syria (ISIS)

media:content.media:credit: Ivor Prickett for The New York Times
media:content.media:description: A scene at Al-Hol detention camp in Kurdish-controlled northern Syria in 2019. Around 55,000 people, mostly women and children, live there in difficult conditions.
